title: Best Early October Prime Day MacBook Deals
content:
Macworld

Do you know what’s better than getting a hot new Apple MacBook? Getting a great deal on a hot new Apple MacBook. One of the best times of the year to get good shopping deals is during one of Amazon’s Prime Day Sales.

Amazon has multiple sales specifically for Prime subscribers throughout the year. There’s Prime Day in July, a Spring Sale in March, and in October you can save money with Amazon’s Prime Big Deal Days. This year’s October Prime Sale is from Tuesday 10 to Wednesday 11 October.

If you’re lucky, you could find deals on the new MacBook Air or MacBook Pro on Prime Day. We don’t often see specific ‘Prime Day’ deals on the newest Macs, but we often see Amazon discount Macs and the best deals can be found around these sales. Below you will find links to the MacBook Air and MacBook Pro on Amazon so it will be easy to find the best deals. During the Prime Day sales we will be tracking the sales, so be sure to check this page often as the deals change all the time.

If it’s an iMac or Mac mini you are after check out our separate round-up of the best Amazon Prime Day Mac deals.

Note that as these models go out of stock Amazon may offer a refurbished model in place, or may redirect to a different model, so do check for this.

Amazon U.S.:

  • 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip (256GB): $1,239 ($60 off, MSRP $1,299)
  • 13-inch MacBook Pro with M2 chip (512GB): $1,424 ($75 off, MSRP $1,499)
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (16‑core GPU, 512GB): $1,999 (full price, MSRP $1,999)
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19‑core GPU, 1TB): $1,949 ($550 off, MSRP $2,499)
  • 14-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Max chip (30‑core GPU, 1TB): $3,063.25 ($35.75 off, MSRP $3,099)
  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19‑core GPU, 1TB): $2,624.94 ($74 off, MSRP $2,699)
  • 13-inch MacBook Air, M1 (256GB): $899 ($100 off, MSRP $999)
  • 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (10-core GPU, 256GB): $1,244 ($55 off, MSRP $1,299)
  • 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (10-core GPU, 512GB): $1,434 ($65 off, MSRP $1,499)

  • 16-inch MacBook Pro with M2 Pro chip (19‑core GPU), 16GB RAM, 1TB SSD: £2,579.98 (£319.02 off, MSRP £2,899)

  • 15-inch MacBook Air, M2 (512GB) £1,429.97 (£170 off, MSRP £1,599)

Read on to see the kind of savings and discounts that might be on offer for Prime Day, and to find out how to get Amazon Prime (which costs $14.99 / £8.99 / AUD$6.99 on a monthly basis, but can be canceled after 30 days) so you can take advantage of the deals.

Looking for a hard drive or a monitor to go with your new Mac? Read:

  • Best Mac monitor deals for Prime Day
  • Best SSD and hard drive deals for Prime Day 

We’ll start with the MacBook Pro, but if it’s a MacBook Air you are after there are deals for that in the section below. Also note that the price of older Macs increased outside the U.S. in January, so the discounts on older products may not be as good as they were last year.

IDG

Prime Day: Best MacBook charger deals

Foundry

Prime Day is also a great opportunity to save some cash on buying a new, spare or just beefier charger for your MacBook.

A wall charger plugs straight into the wall power socket, while desktop chargers connect to the socket by a longer cable and usually boast more ports.

In July 2023, Amazon U.S. featured the following discounts on USB-C PD MacBook chargers:

  • Ugreen 200W USB-C Desktop Charger, 6-port 200W GaN desktop charger, $129.99 (35% off)
  • Anker GaNPrime 65W USB-C Charger, 3-Port fast compact foldable wall charger, $38.99 (35% off)
  • Ugreen 65W Nexode 3-Port GaN USB-C Charger, compact foldable USB-C wall charger with 3 ports, $29.99 (40% off)
  • Nekteck 65W USB-C Charger, 1-port GaN II wall charger with 6.6ft Cable, $24.79 (38% off)
  • Anker 747 150W GaNPrime Charger, 4-Port compact foldable GaN USB-C charger, $74.99 (32% off)
  • Ugreen 65W Charging Station, 7-in-1 USB-C power strip with 6ft extension cord, $43.36 (46% off)

In the U.K.:

  • Ugreen 65W Nexode GaN Charger, 3-port 65W USB-C charger with US/UK/EU Plug for travel, $37.99 (24% off)
  • Ugreen 100W Power Strip DigiNest Pro, 100W GaN extension lead with USB-C slots, 2 AC outlets & 3 USB-C & USB-A, $83.99 (23% off)

Prime Day: How can I get the best MacBook deals?

Once Prime Day begins, most deals will be exclusive for Prime members, so you’ll need to sign in with an active membership to purchase one of the deals. Prime memberships cost $139 / £95 annually, or $14.99 / £8.99 / AU$6.99 on a monthly basis. New users can sign up for a 30-day free trial that can be canceled at any time during the trial window. As well as access to sales prices, Prime members also get free two-day shipping and access to Prime Video and all the content available on that service.
